alert.note: Alert for Shishmaref (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 08 at 2:41PM AKST until December 09 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Additional snow accumulations of 2 inches. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Freezing spray will accumulate into a light glaze. * WHERE...Diomede. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Ice will make traveling surfaces slippery. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong north winds will cause snow squalls with periods of very low visibility through Saturday. The winds combined with temperatures in the teens will cause freezing spray to accumulate into a light glaze through Saturday. Winds are expected to decrease Saturday afternoon and blowing snow and freezing spray will diminish then. Gale force north winds are expected to return Sunday night and continue into Wednesday which will bring a return to snow squalls and blowing snow with low visibility and freezing spray.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
